item.title: A shelter outside from pallets and piles of rubbish over the pavement. They are opposite the red arches about two thirds of the way down the street from the pedestrian access end. The shelter looks like a big pile of old furniture, 26th September

item.title: Danby Street overgrown with weeds, 26th September
item.description:
Danby Street looks like ‘28 days later’ . No weeding has happened at all this year. It says on your website that you do do it, has this been sacrificed cos of lack of funds? Or is this a new green environmental policy ? Won’t the paving stones and concrete start cracking with this amount of growth?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Danby Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Again and again full of waste bags, furniture dumped on pavement from Camberwell to Elephant main road, 26th September
item.description:
Do you understand it is cannot continue like this every day people must walking throw to rubbish ?! Where are cleaning cars on roads? You never see any EU country dirty , full rubbish on street like here London, Southwark. You need clean streets more frequentlly , it is reallity. Do you work on this how to STOP this mess and provide clean, hygienic, tidy streets for every day lives ????!!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Larcom Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Politically charged graffiti, 26th September
item.description:
Large graffiti on the railway bridge walkway between avenue road and the north end road. It reads ‘send them back’ with a St George’s cross. This has appeared in the last day or so. For many Bexley residents leaving this kind of messaging undealt with for long creates an environment of division and a horrible feeling within the local community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queens Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken bottle and rubbish along pavement and street, 26th September
item.description:
26 Sept: Rubbish and broken glass has been along the pavement and curb for nearly 2 weeks. This road is a litter hotspot - can it be cleaned more frequently please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): White Hart Road, Goddington, London
